intro: Barleria asterotricha, commonly known as the star-haired barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its foliage is often covered with fine, star-shaped hairs, giving it its common name. Barleria asterotricha is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
